reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Strengthening and expansion of DOTS services in the Gambia

description.narrative: The annual burden of all forms of tuberculosis (TB) in The Gambia is estimated to be 4,415 cases (TB incidence of 257 per 100,000 population), including 1,893 (113 per 100,000 population) smear-positive TB cases. The goal of the Program is aligned with the National Strategic Plan for Tuberculosis Control (2008-2012) i.e. to reduce transmission, morbidity and mortality of TB so that it is no longer a public health problem. It aims to increase access to TB diagnosis and treatment, to achieve the minimum 70% percent case detection rate and at least 85 percent treatment success rate. It is expected that the Program will build upon the achievements of the Round 5 Global Fund funded grant, which is expected to end in 2011, but also tackle several challenges, including a relatively high TB mortality rate, a weak referral system, and areas with spatial clustering of TB cases. The Program will be implemented through dual-track financing arrangement, which will be implemented in the country by two Principal Recipients. The current grant will focus on the identification/treatment of infectious TB cases, increasing access to HIV counselling and testing for TB patients, and on the introduction of the Practical Approach to Lung Health Strategy.

Coverage / Output indicator for GMB-T-NLTP
Number of health workers per 10,000 population (report on community health workers as applicable)
Percentage of bacteriologically confirmed TB cases successfully treated (cured plus completed treatment) among the bacteriologically confirmed TB cases registered during a specified period
Annual rate of retention of service providers at primary health care facilities
Number of notified cases of bacteriologically confirmed TB, new and relapses
Percentage of TB patients who had an HIV test result recorded in the TB register
Number of notified cases of all forms of TB (i.e. bacteriologically confirmed + clinically diagnosed), new and relapse cases

Percentage of laboratories showing adequate performance in external quality assurance for smear microscopy among the total number of laboratories that undertake smear microscopy during the reporting period
Number of TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB notified
Number of cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB that began second-line treatment
Percentage of HMIS or other routine reporting units submitting timely reports according to national guidelines
Percentage of reporting units reporting no stock-outs of anti-TB drugs on the last day of the quarter
Percentage of HIV-positive registered TB patients given anti-retroviral therapy during TB treatment
Percentage of previously treated TB patients receiving DST (bacteriologically positive cases only)
Percentage of HIV-positive patients who were screened for TB in HIV care or treatment settings
Percentage of people living with HIV initiated on ART who are screened for TB in HIV treatment settings
Percentage of health facilities reporting no stock-outs of essential drugs
Percentage of health facilities with essential medicines and life-saving commodities in stock

Treatment success rate- all forms: Percentage of TB cases, all forms, bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, successfully treated (cured plus treatment completed) among all TB cases registered for treatment during a specified period, new and relapse cases
Number of TB cases (all forms) notified among key affected populations/ high risk groups (other than prisoners)
